weeks.summary: Dune 3.20.2 release resolved critical regressions while OxCaml advanced SIMD optimizations and ecosystem maintenance continued
Critical memory model fixes in core runtime while advancing backend optimization and infrastructure modernization
Dune 3.20.0 release with package management performance issues while advancing multicore and language enhancements
Backend development acceleration in OxCaml with JSIR and LLVM advances, runtime improvements in core, and ecosystem package releases
Dune 3.20.0 alpha releases and OxCaml backend development progress with type checker enhancements and runtime optimizations
Runtime optimization and OxCaml parameterized libraries development with dune 3.20.0 alphas and governance transparency progress
Runtime optimization and polymorphic parameters advancement with opam 2.4.1 release and advanced IDE refactoring capabilities
Major release week with opam 2.4.0 and odoc 3.1.0 shipped alongside modular explicits advancement and cross-tool refactoring improvements
Module system improvements and governance development alongside active ecosystem package releases and experimental tooling features
OPAM 2.4.0~rc1 released with performance optimizations while transparent ascription RFC gains approval for implementation phase
Major releases with Merlin 5.5-503 and OCaml-LSP 1.23.0, plus OCaml 5.4 regression fixes and tooling integration improvements
OPAM 2.4.0-beta1 released with deps-only improvements while addressing compiler crashes and ecosystem compatibility challenges
ThreadSanitizer stability work, Dune 3.19.1 release, and advanced metaprogramming development across ecosystem groups
OCaml 5.2 compatibility updates merged, Flambda2 optimizations completed, multicore performance improvements addressed
Multicore performance challenges addressed while OxCaml compatibility expanded and OCaml 5.4 ecosystem preparation advanced
Multicore performance investigations and Dune 3.19.0 release with advanced language features and OCaml 5.4.0 ecosystem coordination
Transparent ascription RFC approved for implementation while OCaml 5.3 compatibility and WebAssembly development continued across tools
GC stability fixes merged in core, opam 2.4.0~alpha2 released, and ARM64 compiler improvements across platform tools
GC stability fixes and parser modernization in core compiler while Dune 3.18.2 addressed OCaml 5.4 compatibility
Transparent ascription RFC gained prototype approval while Docker compatibility and optimization work dominated tools development
Major tool releases with opam 2.4.0-alpha1 and Dune 3.18.1 while type system features merged in core compiler
Module system advances with transparent ascription RFC approved for OCaml Foundation funding while cross-platform tools fixes addressed
Dune 3.18.0 release highlights tooling advances while core compiler addresses memory safety and cross-platform issues
Relocatable OCaml RFC submission alongside toolchain improvements and OCaml 5.3 compatibility work
